snippet.textDisplay: "It's not fair to criticize an individual player" then starts to criticize an individual player. Lovren stepped up this season when Gomez was still injured and contributed big performances. Of course he's not the first choice, and yeah he's prone to mistakes, but you can't completely disregard his contributions to this team during the early parts of this run. He played poorly, but so did like every other player on the pitch. I appreciate Lovren's contributions this season, and I'm also disappointed in all of the performances from this game. There's space for both things to be true, yeah?

Getting beat was bound to happen at some point, with the exception of one or two players not many can hold there head up and say they played well, but that is football.
When we win the league we will not remember the bad performances, actually couldn't care less if we win the league by a single point and win the CL and FA cup. History looks at facts and not how well one particular player did in any particular instance.
We have a squad for a reason and we can only play 11 players at a time. Some are better than others that is for sure, although Lovren has been adorning lead boots for a few years now i think he must have bought a few extra pairs and lent them out over the weekend!
YNWA #19League + #7CL + #8FA!

snippet.textDisplay: Think they outsmarted the LFC players in that game. That's all. 1st game, Lovren got stuck out of position in the box. Then Watford players all over the middle inside the box, outnumbered. Once the ball got away from VVD, easy. Second one, Lovren got too close to VVD, the ball skipped past both in one through pass, but it was awkward and the pace was slow from both centre backs. Third goal... Lovren out of position and the back line look disjointed as a whole. Think it needs a thorough review back in the training room and the entire squad debriefed over the errors made. Then how to avoid, it's Watford there. It means many other remaining fixtures can end up the same.

snippet.textDisplay: Mad to scapegoat one player when we lost 3-0 and had one shot on target. The performances have been below par for a few weeks now, not sure what the problem is, I think maybe teams have found a way to play against us, Klopp will sort it out and it will be fine. The disappointment is that we could have achieved so much more and we kind of threw it away without much of a fight. If we’d have lost it to City it would have been more painful but equally more understandable. If we’d have gone down to Watford having lost 1-0 and just had some bad luck and deserved to win that would have been understandable too. It’s just gutting that we lost our heads, didn’t really threaten and were deserved losers against a poor side. On the bright side, we now have zero distractions going for the FA cup or Champions League if we can get past a Chelsea and turn it around against Atletico. We essentially need to win 4 games in the league and now we aren’t going for invincible we can take our foot of the gas a little bit and rest players for the cup competitions. If we can win either the CL/PL double, FA cup/PL double or the treble no one is going to remember losing to Watford in the league. The focus will have shifted.

snippet.textDisplay: Needed Matip, overall the best partner for Van Dijk to me, was critical in defense in our run last year for the league and the champions league. Matip is just as underrated as Henderson, but Matip defends well, tall, got a bit of pace, and most importantly loves the occasional dribble forward and looks for gaps to make a forward pass. Thats what Liverpool needed yesterday. Also the front 3 are losing their blade, they just want to be in the box to score goals, they need to learn to shoot from outside the box or from distance like Haaland against PSG or like Lallana did yesterday when he hit the post. It was just a bad day at the office, bc lacked commitment and desire to win. Ignore the haters who come out just bc Liverpool lost their first game and arent going unbeaten, we are still gonna win the league and Anfield is gonna turn over Atletico. Keep going boys, Y.W.N.A.

snippet.textDisplay:
Allison - Fine
Robbo - I dont know what happened to him, but everytime he got the ball he slowed it down and was always looking to pass the ball back into the middle. Really gave me flashes of Rafa style football.
VVD - Fine. Was kind of shaky but not too bad.
Lovren - Lovren
Trent - Looked tired and unfocused.
Fabinho - The only one I thought actually had a good game.
Wijnaldum - Has looked uninterested for a while now, maybe the contract thing is throwing him but he needs some time on the sidelines.
Ox - Tried his best but still needs a good run of games to get back in the zone like he was towards the end of 2017/18.
Mane - Is always trying his best but it just isnt coming off for him at the moment.
Firmino - Bring in Werner.
Salah - Bring in Sancho.


Salah and Firmino have it too easy, the fact that they have been playing so poor for so long and still dont need to worry about their place is symptomatic of our form recently. Personally i feel that we havent done enough to freshen up. Werid saying that considering we have only lost 1 game, but seriously when is the last game we can look to for a Proper good performance? Sheffield Utd would be the one I go for. That was 2 months ago. Leicester 4-0 and then Everton 5-2 and City 3-1. They would be the only games I can look to and say "Yeah we played really well". Like how many times have we had to hear commentators this season saying "Liverpool not really hitting their stride" or "Not a vintage Liverpool performance" or something along the lines of that? Because for me it seems to be every other week.
But back to the point about freshness. Firmino's last goal at anfield was 10 and a half months ago. I know he is not an out and out goalscorer and brings alot to the team, but has he been recently? I say he hasnt. When teams sit back, which they have to now, he has to drop so deep its like having 4 in the midfield. Now put Aguero in that same team, he can have 3 players around him and still smash a goal in from anywhere around the box. I am in no way trying to have a go at bobby, but for the moment his contribution is seriously starting to be hurt because he cant operate against teams with a double low block. Maybe a Timo Werner is exactly what we need at the minute, someone who can spin and smash a goal from nothing. As for Salah, good god I have no idea what has happened to him, he is attempting 1.6 dribbles per match and has a succes rate of 56%. In 17/18 he attempted 2.3 dribbles per match with a success rate of 64%. I looked that up after last night because I have noticed more and more he isnt taking people on, he gets the ball into feet and just tries to shield it and ends up losing the ball most of the time and, considering we know how good of a dribbler he is, i think his form is the most frustrating at the minute.
But I will say this, I dont know if I am crazy or not, but ever since Klopp first took over, everytime there is an international, or break of any kind, we always take a few weeks where we are crap. I think 16/17 is the best example of it where we had just beaten Watford 6-1 at Anfield and were soaring in the clouds, top of the league and smashing in goals for fun. Came back after an international, drew with southampton, were very unconvincing against sunderland then lost to Bournemouth and drew with West Ham. And I have noticed this each season with Klopp so maybe there is something deeper.
Am I daring to attack Klopp? Good god no. The man has done more for this club than the last 6 managers combined and I know how sour i sound at the moment, but I am just very concerned as to the sustainability of our current team when they are churning out more bog standard performances than good ones. Personally the most entertaining season I have ever witnessed was 2017/18, with 2013/14 coming a close second. But the amount of absolutely brilliant performances that were coming from all over the pitch was just breathtaking, the only thing costing us that year was just so many individual mistakes. Now it just feels like a chore to watch us play alot of the time. I am not saying I would trade this season for another 17/18, I mean we are about to win the fckn Premier League for the first time in my lifetime, I just am worried that we may be in for another collapse, like 2014/15.
